intro: Pisum fulvum, commonly known as the yellow field pea, is a legume native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its yellow pods and small, round seeds that are typically harvested when mature. The plant grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with trifoliate leaves and small white or pale purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its edible seeds, which are rich in protein. The botanical features of Pisum fulvum make it a valuable crop in both traditional and modern agricultural systems.
